page.title: 09Hillfield Hall, Solihull
page.content: {Thomas Hawes of Shirley}bought a farm in 1311. The farmhouse probably stood within the confines of a moat but nothing now remains of this building. In 1576{William Hawes}built the present{Hillfield Hall.}It was one of the first all brick buildings in the area. A serious fire in the 18th. century destroyed much of the rear of the building. It is the oldest building in the area and has recently been redeveloped into a restaurant. The stables of Hillfield Hall have been converted into a public house. The stables are supposed to have their own ghost. The story is that a young soldier went upstairs to the hay store, pretending that he was getting food for his horse and hung himself from a beam.
